abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was highly
            satisfactory. The Bank performed successfully in all stages
            of the project, and in particular, was instrumental in
            providing recommendations to the Shandong Provincial
            Electric Power Bureau (SPEPB), in the revision of project
            costs, cautioning about implementation delays of project
            components, in early stages, and, ensuring a timely
            completion. This in turn, translated into a close
            cooperation with the borrower, whose understanding of
            management performance was conducive to a successful
            international standardization process. The tariff reform
            action plan, has now the full commitment from SPEPB, to
            continue the tariff reforms within the agreed framework.
            Time an again, the lessons show, that implementing agencies,
            with strong ownership and commitment are key to success.
            However, and regardless of success, it is suggested that
            procurement should be determined early on, to minimize
            interface work during implementation. Furthermore, although
            experienced foreign consultants were selected, certain
            issues, such as engineering, construction, and,
            commissioning, did not meet the implementing agencies'
            expectations, although did not affect the project adversely.
            To ensure timely policy reforms, further guidance could be
            provided by the Bank, particularly at the early stages.

5077587.majtheme: Public sector governance,Environment and natural resource management

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objectives of the project
            are to : i) alleviate the acute power shortage in Shandong;
            ii) develop large modern mine-mouth thermal power generating
            stations to make effective use of China's abundant coal
            resources; iii) continue the effort to transfer the
            appropriate advanced technology in plant design and project
            management for 600 MW thermal power units; iv) provide
            technical assistance to Shandong Provincial Electric Power
            Bureau (SPEPB) for institution building in the areas of
            environmental planning for thermal power stations and
            improving electricity tariff structures; and v) upgrade
            SPEPB's capability in financial management.  Project
            components consist of : a) the addition of two 600 MW
            generating units to the existing Zouxian thermal power plant
            to raise its total capacity to 2,400 MW; b) construction of
            500 kv and 220 kv transmission lines and substations; c)
            provision of consulting services; d) provision of technical
            assistance to study the impact on air quality of thermal
            power expansion programs; e) carrying out a power tariff
            study; and f) a training program for the technical,
            financial and management staff of SPEPB.
